intro: Hieracium majus, commonly known as the greater hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow flowers bloom from June to August, and it produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium majus is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
